comments:
The flexible project wizard (launched from new EAR) is not displaying validation
warnings. e.g. "You must enter a proejct name", "that is not a valid project
name", etc.  Also if you enter a . there are null pointers when attempting to
validate the path:

There are still a few more problems here.  "You must enter a proejct name" (or
something to the effect) should be displayed if there is no project name entered
(but not when the wizard first shows up).  Also, the wizard thinks whitespace is
valild.
Just assigning to specific component based on abstract.
attempting to set back to previous assigned owner after changing component
This is still broken.  try entering ... for the project name and hitting finish.

Project name ending with periods is a bug from base eclipse, i have opened 
a defect  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=97712
Changed Version field given new release numbering.
